instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Hall Effect board Capacitor Corroded
threads.message:
Hello

Do anyone happen to know what cap value the hall effect board uses or a substitute. The board i'm working on has a corroded cap and the schematic doesn't specify the parts on the board. Its located on J5260 - AMR-MLB-X502

Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Hall Effect board Capacitor Corroded
threads.message:
I doubt is really needed.
Try without it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Hall Effect board Capacitor Corroded
threads.message: I second this. Most of time if the hall sensor fails, it?s the pads under it that get burned

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Hall Effect board Capacitor Corroded
threads.message: Yeah, don't think my issue is with the hall effect sensor. Pull the corroded cap and still not booting though cpu is warm. I'll start a new tread for this new issue. Thanks guys.
